text: John Paul Shasky (born July 31, 1964) is a retired American professional basketball player, a 6'11" (211 cm) and 235 lb (107 kg) center. Born in Birmingham, Michigan, he played collegiately at the University of Minnesota for four seasons (from 1982 to 1986). Shasky was selected with the 14th pick of the third round (61st pick overall) in the 1986 NBA Draft by the Utah Jazz. He played in the NBA for 3 seasons for the Miami Heat (1988/89), Golden State Warriors (1989/90), and Dallas Mavericks (1990/91), averaging 3.8 points and 2.8 rebounds per game in 11.1 minutes per game on average. ==External links== *NBA stats @ basketballreference.com Category:1964 births Category:Living people Category:American expatriate basketball people in France Category:American expatriate basketball people in Greece Category:American expatriate basketball people in Italy Category:American expatriate basketball people in Spain Category:Apollon Patras B.C. players Category:Basket Brescia Leonessa players Category:Basketball players from Michigan Category:CB Valladolid players Category:Cholet Basket players Category:Centers (basketball) Category:Dallas Mavericks players Category:Golden State Warriors players Category:Iraklis Thessaloniki B.C. players Category:Joventut Badalona players Category:Liga ACB players Category:Minnesota Golden Gophers men's basketball players Category:Miami Heat players Category:Pallacanestro Trapani players Category:Papagou B.C. players Category:People from Birmingham, Michigan Category:Rapid City Thrillers players Category:Utah Jazz draft picks Category:American men's basketball players Category:CEP Lorient players
title: John Shasky
